title: Around the Districts : Achonry - Mullinabreena to Cloonacool
body_text:
Around the Districts: Achonry-Mullinabreena to Cloonacool
ACHONRY-MULLINABREENA
Fruit and Veg Ordering Service at Achonry Farmers Market
You can now create your very own unique fruit and veg box to suit your household needs and requirements. Simply message 087 7981827 and place your order before midday every Thursday and collect from Achonry Farmers Market the following Saturday, 10 a.m. to 1 p.m. However, big or small your order is, the Markets new supplier, Joe Kelly, is happy to oblige. A simple way to support this local amenity and maintain it in the community. A variety of household necessities and treats are available from the small businesses at the market.
Bealtaine Celebrations
Music, song, performance and May Day traditions. Refreshments served. Come and enjoy. Some ‘special guests’ will also be making an appearance – May 11 at Achonry Farmers Market.
Knocknashee Hub
May 3 is the first Friday of the month, so that means a Hoolie in the Hub starts at 9 p.m. The Three Hill Cafe opens every Saturday and Sunday, 10 a.m. to 2 p.m., why not pop along for a coffee and a treat.
Coolaney-Mullinabreena GAA Club lotto 2024 Launch
The main club fundraiser, the club lotto 2024 was launched last week. The lotto is a crucial income stream for the club in that it funds principal day to day expenses and keeps facilities at Nace O’Dowd Park to the highest of standards for all who use it. Tickets remain at €100 which includes 12 draws for cash prizes and the jackpot which is currently at a very appealing €7,200. Contact any committee member for details or you can subscribe by visitingmember.clubforce.com.
25 Drive
25 Drive In St Nathy’s Hall every Friday at 8.30 p.m.
Social Dancing
Social dancing class takes place in Cloonacool Community Centre every Thursday at 8 p.m.
BALLYMOTE
Social Dance
A Social Dance will be held in the Loftus Hall, Ballymote on Sunday, May 5, from 8 p.m. to 10.30 p.m. Music by Ally Harran and Marian Curry. Admission €10.
Ballymote Tidy Towns
A date for your diary – Ballymote Tidy Towns will host a guided Dawn Chorus Stroll and Talk on Sunday, May 26, at 4.30 a.m. The meeting point is the bandstand in the Town Park. Meanwhile, we continue to prepare for this year’s competition and would really appreciate your help with the following: please keep the areas outside your home/business tidy and complete any decorating projects before judging in mid-June to early July. It would be great if more properties could add a window box or planter to brighten up the town and improve biodiversity.
Community Lotto
There was no winner of Ballymote Community lotto jackpot on Sunday, April 21. Numbers drawn were 2, 6, 7 and 18. There were three match-three winners, name of winners displayed locally. The jackpot now stands at €5,400. Next draw will take place on Sunday, May 5. Envelopes for Ballymote Community lotto are now on sale in Ballymote and District Credit Union, John Doddy’s Bar and Lounge, Alan O’Sullivan Butchers. €2 for one line/row, €5 for three lines/rows. Online sales will continue as normal. The draw will now take place every two weeks on Sunday night. Thank you for your continued support.
Congratulations
Congratulations to the parents of Ivy Mae Flynn, whose baptism took place recently.
Sympathy
Sympathy is extended to the family, relatives and friends of Leslie Langan, Essex and formerly Marren Park, whose death occurred recently.
Coleman Community Cinema
On Saturday, May 4, at 2.30 p.m. we will be showing the Disney musical remake ~ The Little Mermaid at Coleman Community Cinema, Coleman Music Centre, Gurteen, Co. Sligo F56 TF88. Treat bags are available. Admission €5.
HELLO HOW ARE YOU DAY
A coffee morning will be held at the Ballymote Day care centre, Lord Edward St, on May 15 from 10.30 a.m. to midday. Everybody is welcome. Donations are gratefully accepted and will be donated to a charitable group.
MINDFULNESS and NUTRITION
Ballymote FRC is hoping to run a Mindfulness and nutrition class at the centre. Mindfulness includes guided walking, eating meditation and deep relaxation. This is a free class. Please phone 071 9197818 for more details.
BREASTFEEDING SUPPORT
Support with breastfeeding is available at Ballymote FRC. Please contact Patricia Carroll at patriciaA.carroll@hse.ie for more details.
SOCIAL PRESCRIBING
This is a free support offered by the HSE which aims to improve people’s health and wellbeing by giving people information on social groups and exercise classes available in the local area. A link worker will be available at Ballymote FRC once a month on Wednesdays. Please contact Loretta McLoughlin at 083 4036985 or email lorettasfrc@gmail.com for more details.
WOMEN’S GROUP
A women’s group meets at Ballymote FRC, Monday evenings from 8 p.m. to 9.30 p.m. Please contact 071 9197818 for more details.
Notes
Anyone who wishes to have news items included in the notes, please email miriamsfinn@eircom.net or phone 085 7561547.The deadline for submission of notes is 5 p.m. every Thursday.
CARRAROE
Carraroe Progressive 25 Card Game
Our jackpot of €300 was not won. The first prize of €150 was won by Christopher Maloney and Niall Gordon on 11 games with the second prize of €60 shared by John McLean and Tena Gildea, Bernadette White and Pat Collery, Mary Lee and Ina Toolan all on 10 games. Our final game for this season is Tuesday, May 7, when we will be adding a few extra prize opportunities. The game will recommence again on Tuesday, August 27. Looking forward to seeing all players on Tuesday for 9 p.m. start of game – for more information telephone 089 2459123 or email cadrasligo1@gmail.com. All welcome.
Carraroe National School lotto
Numbers Drawn: 1, 6, 11, 14. €20 winner Fergal Callaghan.
You can now do a local lotto and help our National School in the process. One Line for €2.50 or three lines for €5. To support the draw, visit ourfundraiser.ie/org/carraroens.
Carraroe Exercise Sessions
We have now commenced a Tuesday session at 12.30 p.m. to 1.30 p.m. Our Thursday session at 11 a.m. to 12 p.m. continues. We have a WhatsApp text group specifically for the exercise sessions all welcome to join as it is the method we update people. For more info, ring 089 2459123.or email cadrasligo1@gmail.com.
Weekly Litter Pickers
We are always looking for people to join the effort to keep our area clean all year. Anyone interested in taking on responsibility for the road they live on can contact 089 2459123 or email cadrasligo1@gmail.com and we will supply Hi-Viz Clear bags Picker and Gloves. Bags can be left to the collection point at community centre each Monday evening or Tuesday am.
Carraroe Community Information WhatsApp Group
This text group has been established to assist organising the community and giving information to the wider Carraroe area. Anyone interested joining the text group can send a text to 087 2222835 and you will be added to the group.
Seniors Alarm Scheme
Cadra would urge all eligible residents to avail of the scheme as it a great comfort and support to people. Anyone over 65 is eligible. Currently anyone with a land line the first year is free and €60 following years. If you do not have a land line you can still get it via GSM and it will cost €60 first year and €120 following year.
Anyone that already has the alarm is advised to wear the pendent at all times including in shower/bath (it’s waterproof) and bed. You are also advised to test the alarm each month as its reassuring all is working and the people monitoring it are happy to assist. Press the red button on pendant and let them answer you
Application forms and full details are available from website cadra.ie or telephone 089 2459123.
Illegal Dumping
All residents are requested to keep a look out for type of activity and use the telephone number 1850365121 to report. You can also use the following contact points to report: Sligo County Council Litter Warden: Telephone 071 9111465/071 9111457 or Mobile: 087 1778735 – Email enviro@sligococo.
Dog Fouling
People walking their dogs in Carraroe are requested to remove fouling and please bring home and bin. Do not dump it in hedges as volunteers have to remove it. We have noticed a few black spots where this is occurring recently. Pooper-scoopers are available free from Sligo County Council.
Ballinacarrow Progressive 25
The progressive 25 Card Game each Thursday at 9 p.m. in Ballinacarrow Community Centre. All card players are welcome.
Eircode Number
All households are advised the Eircode number of your house will assist Ambulance and other emergency services to find your house faster. All residents are advised to place their house Eircode number on all telephones used to summon emergency services to ensure it is available immediately.
Text Alert in Carraroe
You can download the application form from cadra.ie. And post it with contribution of €10 for each registered mobile. The system is now active. We can always add individuals any time should you wish to be added.
Dancing in Carraroe Community Centre
Learn to Dance Jive, waltz, Quick Step in Carraroe Community Centre each Wednesday at 8 p.m. Social dancing from 9.00 p.m. to 11 p.m. For more information, call Frank at 087 9809432.
Slimway Class in Carraroe
Ann is attending Carraroe Community Centre each Wednesday from 7.30 a.m. to 10 a.m., and again Wednesday evening from 4 p.m. to 6 p.m., and each Friday morning 9 a.m. to 10.30 a.m. Everyone welcome. Enquiries to Ann 087 2362487 or slimway.ie.
St John’s GAA lotto
Jackpot €22,700. Draw is next Saturday, May 4.
Numbers Drawn: 10, 22, 27, 31. No jackpot winner. €25 winners were David Curtin, Ray Henry Snr, F Barry, Geraldine Kilkenny.
Tickets are available in the following outlets – Molly Fulton’s, Canning’s, Pearse Road, Christies Supermarket Pearse Road, McMorrow’s, Cairns Road, Applegreen Petrol Station Carraroe, Clifford’s Electrical, Centre Fillan’s Castle St or any club member. You can also play online at St John’s GAA webpage.
News/Events Contact
To have events/news items included in Carraroe section, contact 087 2222835 or email carraroesligonews@gmail.com not later than Friday am each week.
CLOONACOOL
Local Concert
Local music aficionado, Chris Stapleton, is hosting a concert at Murphy’s Hotel on this Wednesday, May 1, next. The show will feature top-notch folk musicians Ger O’Donnell and Trevor Sexton. Doors 7 p.m. Tickets are €20 and available from the hotel or you can phone 071 9185598 to book.
Day for Emma
Emma Kilcoyne (daughter of Aidan and Mary), is heading off later in the summer to undertake some charity work with underprivileged communities in Fiji. The Mill Café have decided to donate the takings of the café on Saturday, May 4. Additional donations for Emma’s fund are also welcomed on that day. Our community is always proud to see our young people show a helping hand in places of need around the world. The café opens at the regular times each weekend; Friday, 11 a.m. to 2 p.m. and Saturday and Sunday, 10 a.m. 2 p.m. Entrance to the café, which is now fully wheelchair accessible, is through the new porch.
Park lotto
The following is the result of the recent Community Park lottos in March and April. There was no jackpot winner in March. The following were winners of match-three numbers: Graham Doyle and Bill Carty, who share €200. Angela Sweeney won the monthly €30 Surlis SuperValu voucher. In the April draw, again there was no jackpot winner. There was only one winner of the match 3; Gary Kilcullen, who took the full €200. The €30 Surlis SuperValu voucher winner was Noel Wynne. The Park Committee continues to express their gratitude for the great support shown to their lotto fundraiser.
First Holy Communion
The date for the celebration of First Holy Communion for the children of the parish takes place in Cloonacool on Saturday, May 11, at 11 a.m.
Best wishes to the children involved and special thanks to Fr Sherlock and the teachers in St Michael’s NS for this work.
Mothers and Others
Gaelic for Mothers and Others with CT Gaels is returning for 2024. New or returning for another season, please drop a text to Shauna at 087 1002714.
There are great benefits including, getting fit, learning a new skill, fun and friendly, social aspect, non-competitive, no football experience needed, do as much as you can.
The only restriction is, you must not be currently playing Gaelic football competitively. Training will be once a week. We look forward to seeing you.
Notes
Notes for this column are always welcome. Deadline is midday on Friday. Email to cloonacoolnotes@gmail.com.
